isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES70-5 - REASSEMBLY - CASE

step1.para: Use a hoist to install the countershaft assembly into the case ( Figure 48).

Place the bearings and spacer in the reverse idler gear. Position the reverse idler gear and thrust washers in the case ( Figure 49). Next, use a rubber mallet to install the idler shaft with the flat side facing the bearing cap.
Assemble the countershaft rear bearing cap and shims ( Figure 50), but do not apply an anaerobic sealant until after end play is checked. Notice how the idler shaft and bearing cap align.

figure.caption: Figure 50. Countershaft Rear Bearings and Shim

step1.para: Use the proper driver to install the front countershaft bearing race. Install the lubrication spacer into the countershaft front bearing bore ( Figure 51). Install the clutch housing and gasket. Secure with bolts. Tighten to 120 to 150 ft-lbs. (163 to 203 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 51. Lubrication Spacer Into Countershaft Bore

step1.para: Check countershaft end play ( Figure 52). It must be set between .001 and .008 inch (.025 and .203mm) for proper unit functioning. Adjustments can be made by re-shimming if necessary. Reinstall the rear countershaft bearing cap using purple Loctite 515® or equivalent. Secure with bolts. Tighten to 60 to 80 ft-lbs. (81 to 109 N•m).
Use a chain hoist to lift the mainshaft assembly into the case ( Figure 53).
Lubricate the pocket bearing with Moly #2 lubricant ( Figure 54).

Install the input shaft, bearing cap, and gasket ( Figure 55). Make sure a protective sleeve is used to protect the bearing cap seal when sliding the cap over the shaft ( Figure 56). Secure with bolts. Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Install Input Shaft, Bearing Cap and Gasket
Figure 56. Protective Sleeve Over End of Shaft

caution.para: Red sleeve must be used to prevent serious damage to oil seal when assembling bearing cap. Failure to comply will void seal warranty.

step1.para: Install the speedometer gear, bearing cap gasket, and bearing cap assembly ( Figure 57). Secure with bolts. Tighten to 60 to 80 ft-lbs. (81 to 109 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 57. Install Speedometer Gear, Bearing Cap Gasket

step1.para: Install the end yoke, washer, and nut ( Figure 58). Tighten to 500 to 600 ft-lbs. (678 to 814 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 58. End Yoke, Washer and Nut

step1.para: Rotate the mainshaft to properly seat the bearings ( Figure 59). Place a dial indicator on the output end of the shaft and lift the shaft with pry bars. End play must be between .003 and .008 inch (.08 and .20mm) to ensure proper unit functioning. If necessary, re-shim rear bearing cap to achieve proper end play.
Place all shift clutch gears in neutral ( Figure 60). Install the shifter housing and gasket. Secure them with bolts. Tighten to 20 to 30 ft-lbs. (27 to 41 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Install Shifter Housing and Gasket

step1.para: Bench shift the unit to ensure it is functioning properly. Install the gasket and tower to complete reassembly ( Figure 61).
